sen.j: 周防内侍（すおう の ないし、長暦元年（1037年）頃？ - 天仁2年（1109年）頃？）は、平安時代後期の女流歌人。
sen.e: Suo no Naishi (c.1037-c.1109) was a woman waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet in the late Heian Period.
Suo no Naishi (c. 1037-1109) was a female waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet during the late Heian Period.
Suo no Naishi (c. 1037-1109) was a female waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet during the late Heian Period.
Her father was Suo no Kami (the governor of Suo Province),TAIRA no Munenaka.
Her father was the Suo no Kami (the Governor of the Suo Province), TAIRA no Munenaka.
Her father was the Suo no Kami (the Governor of Suo Province), TAIRA no Munenaka.
sen.cmt: Suo province の the を削除しました。

sen.j: 母は源正職（みなもとのまさもと）。
sen.e: Her mother was MINAMOTO no Masamoto.
Her mother was MINAMOTO no Masamoto.
Her mother was MINAMOTO no Masamoto.

sen.j: 本名は平仲子（たいらのちゅうし）。
sen.e: Suo no Naishi's real name was TAIRA no Chushi.
Suo no Naishi's real name was TAIRA no Chushi.
Suo no Naishi's real name was TAIRA no Chushi.

sen.j: 後冷泉天皇・後三条天皇・白河天皇・堀河天皇の4朝に仕えた。
sen.e: She served four dynasties: Emperor Goreizei, Gosanjo, Shirakawa and Horikawa.
She served through four dynasties under Emperor Goreizei, Emperor Gosanjo, Emperor Shirakawa, and Emperor Horikawa.
She served through four dynasties under Emperor Goreizei, Emperor Gosanjo, Emperor Shirakawa, and Emperor Horikawa.

sen.j: 以後、病のため出家し、までの間に没したようである。
sen.e: After that, it is considered that she became a Buddhist nun because of sickness and died by 1111.
sen.cmt: 「～までの間に」の前が抜けていたのでWikipediaを参照し(1111)を補いました。
sen.e: After that, she is considered to have become a Buddhist nun due to her illness, and appears to have died by 1111.
After that, she is considered to have become a Buddhist nun due to her illness, and appears to have died by 1111.

sen.j: 「高陽院歌合」「中宮権大夫能実歌合」等、歌合には度々参加している。
sen.e: She often participated poetry contests such as "Koyoin poetry contest""Chugu Gon no Daibu Yorizane poetry contest" and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She often participated in poetry contests such as the "Koyo-in Poetry Contest" and the "Chugu Gon no Daibu Yorizane Poetry Contest".
She often participated in poetry contests such as 'The Koyo-in Poetry Contest' and 'The Chugu Gon no Daibu Yorizane Poetry Contest.'
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテーションに修正しました。the を The に修正してクォーテーション内に入れました。

sen.j: 公家・殿上人との贈答歌も残されている。
sen.e: She also left Zotoka (poetry exchanged between a man and a woman) exchanged between Kuge (the Court nobles) and Tenjobito (a high-ranking courtiers allowed into the Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suo no Naishi also left Zotoka (poetry exchanged between a man and a woman) which she exchanged between 'Kuge's (Court noblemen) and 'Tenjobito's (high-ranking courtiers allowed into the Imperial Palace).
Suo no Naishi also left Zotoka (poetry exchanged between a man and a woman) which she exchanged between court nobles and tenjobito (high-ranking courtiers allowed into the Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: Kuge's (Court noblemen) をcourt nobles に修正しました。 'Tenjobito's を tenjobito に修正しました。Tenjobitos/tenjobitoes といった表記は見当たりませんでしたので、このままの形にしてあります。http://books.google.com/books?lr=&cd=1&hl=ja&as_brr=3&q=tenjobitoshttp://books.google.com/books?lr=&cd=1&hl=ja&as_brr=3&q=tenjobitoes

sen.j: 『後拾遺和歌集』以下の勅撰和歌集に35首入集。
sen.e: Her 35 poems were selected for Goshui Wakashu (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
35 of her poems were selected for the Goshui Wakashu (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
35 of her poems were selected for "The Goshui Wakashu" (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other Chokusen wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（レビュー結果：2009/06/30）を参考にthe Goshui Wakashu を"The Goshui Wakashu" に修正しました。

sen.j: 家集には『周防内侍集』がある。
sen.e: She has her own Kashu (collection of poems), "Suo no Naishi anthology"
She has her own Kashu (collection of poems), "Suo no Naishi Anthology"
She has her own Kashu (collection of poems), "Suo no Naishi Anthology".
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。

sen.j: 『栄花物語』続編の作者と想定されている。
sen.e: She was considered as a writer of the continutation of the "Eiga Monogatari (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes)."
She is assumed to have been the author of the sequel to the "Eiga Monogatari (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes)."
She is assumed to have been the author of the sequel to "The Eiga Monogatari" (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes).
sen.cmt: カッコをクォーテーションから出しました。the "Eiga Monogatari" を"The Eiga Monogatari" に修正しました。

sen.e: Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (the Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (the Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (the Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)

sen.j: 67番 春の夜の 夢ばかりなる 手枕に かひなく立たむ 名こそ惜しけれ（「千載和歌集」雑上961）
sen.e: No.64 At spring night, I laid my head on his arm, although it's just one night dream, it's shame to hear, people whispering behind their fans (also No.961 of the first volume of the Miscellaneous of the "Senzai Wakashu", Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years).

No. 67: On a spring night, I laid my head on his arm, although it's just a one night dream, it's shame to hear, people whispering behind their fans (also No. 961 in the 'Miscellaneous' volume of the "Senzai Wakashu (The Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years)."

No. 67: On a spring night, I laid my head on his arm, although it's just a one night dream, it's shame to hear, people whispering behind their fans (also No. 961 in the 'Miscellaneous' volume of 'The Senzai Wakashu' (The Collection of Japanese Poems of a Thousand Years).
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテーションに修正しました。カッコをクォーテーションから出しました。the 'Senzai Wakashu' を'The Senzai Wakashu' に修正しました。
